overview: This subject introduces the concept of microstructure and explores its relationship with processing and properties in the context of basic types of engineering materials and their applications. Topics covered include: diffusion, phase equilibrium and diagrams, phase transformation, metallic alloys, ceramics, polymers, composites, surface and other selected non-mechanical properties.

The topics covered in this subject include diffusion, phase equilibrium and diagrams, phase transformation, metallic alloys, ceramics, polymers, composites, surface and other selected non-mechanical properties.
ilo: Perform analysis of equilibrium phase diagrams and use transformation diagrams to deduce microstructures resulting from specific heat treatments
Describe various engineering materials and their application.
generic_skills: Ability to apply knowledge of science and engineering fundamentals.
Ability to undertake problem identification, formulation, and solution.
Ability to utilise a systems approach to complex problems and to design and operational performance.
Ability to communicate effectively, with the engineering team and with the community at large.

assessment.brief: 2 laboratory sessions during the semester with reports (totalling not more than 4000 words)
assessment.hurdle: Attendance at the labs and submission of written lab reports as required are compulsory.

date_times.contact_hours: 36 hours of lectures, 9 hours of tutorials, and 4 hours of laboratory work
